Description: Limestone segment of an arch; foliate decoration on the underside. The face depicts a nereid on the back of a dolphin with her scarf billowing above her head.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Saqqara (Memphis) (? see comments re: Koptos provenance)
Curator's comments: Rutschowscaya argues for 4th/5th century date and Koptos provenance (see bibliographic records 2000, 1998). see als, Badawy 1978, 3.27, citing G. Duthuit, La sculture copte pl. 33c.
Bibliographic references: Badawy 1978 / Coptic art and archaeology (167, fig.3.94) (gives 6th c. date)
Rutschowscaya 1998 / Conques et tympans du musée du Louvre (291-92) (fragment of same archivault in the Louvre (E 17083) and Coptic Museum (8002) from Koptos)
Lyon 2000 / Coptos : l'Egypte antique aux portes du désert : Lyon, Musée des beaux-arts, 3 février-7 mai 2000 (no. 179 (p.207)) (for 4th-5th c. date)
Paris 2000 / L'art copte en Égypte 2000 ans de christianisme: Exposition présentée à l’Institut du monde arabe, Paris (no. 168 and 169 (p.166))
Eaton-Krauss 2010 / Some Coptic reliefs purportedly from Coptos (202)
